narration: Welcome to this presentation on the water cycle.  We'll explore the continuous movement of water on above and below the surface of the Earth.

title: Evaporation
content:
The sun heats water in rivers, lakes, and oceans.
This causes the water to turn into water vapor and rise into the atmosphere.
image_desc:
A photograph showing water evaporating from a lake or ocean on a sunny day.  Type: photograph

### Video Suggestion:
[Optional: A stock footage video showing water evaporating from a body of water.]
video_desc: [Optional: A stock footage video showing water evaporating from a body of water.]
narration: Let's begin with evaporation. The sun's energy heats bodies of water transforming liquid water into water vapor. This invisible gas then rises into the atmosphere.

title: Condensation
content:
As the water vapor rises, it cools and condenses.
This means it changes back into tiny liquid water droplets or ice crystals.
These droplets or crystals form clouds.
image_desc:
A close-up photograph of water droplets condensing on a cold surface, such as a glass of iced water on a hot day. Type: photograph

narration: As the water vapor rises it cools and condenses forming tiny water droplets or ice crystals. These gather together to create clouds.

title: Precipitation
content: (Caption below the image):  Rain, snow, sleet, or hail falling from the clouds.

narration: When these water droplets or ice crystals become too heavy they fall back to the earth as precipitation  this can be rain snow sleet or hail.

title: Collection
content:
Precipitation collects in rivers, lakes, and oceans.
It also seeps into the ground to become groundwater.
image_desc:
A photograph showing water collecting in a river or lake after a rainfall. Type: photograph

video_desc: [Optional: A stock footage video showing water flowing in a river or stream.]
narration: The precipitation then collects in various places flowing into rivers lakes and oceans or seeping into the ground to become groundwater.  This completes the cycle and the process begins again.
